intro: Notopleura dukei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming compact rosettes. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from white to purple, and are pollinated by insects. Notopleura dukei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
